title: I am neither interested in engineering nor medical. But I do love science. What career do I opt for? I am in a huge confusion. - Quora

response.answer_text: There are a number of career options that a Science student can opt for apart from Engineering and medicine. A popular belief among Science students is that if they fail to qualify in engineering and medical entrances, then they are left with no other career option. However, this is far from being true. Career options for PCM students: Physics: With a Physics major, you develop skills that are applicable to fields such as Aerospace, Geophysics, computational Physics, Biophysics, Nuclear Physics and so on. You can go for research in these areas or you can also opt for a teaching career.Chemistry: Career options in Chemstry include: Chemical Engineering, Pharmaceuticals, Healthcare, Research, Teaching. There are a number of avenues available for employement. The job can be interesting for those who enjoy analytical work. However, the coursework is difficult and the pathway to become a successful chemist is long.Mathematics/Statistics: If you have a degree in Mathematics/Statistics, then you can look forword to a career in Data Science, Banking, Finance, Insurance, Stock Market, Data analysis just to name a few. Apart from these, if you are genuinely interested in Mathematics, you can also go for research or a teaching career.Aviation: A career in aviation is a perfect mix of Science, technology and travel. As a commercial pilot, you can get a chance to work with major domestic/international airlines. Refer to the link to learn how to become a pilot in India: Get Ready to Fly! Your All-in-One Guide to Becoming a Pilot in IndiaInformation Technology: All of us are aware of the immense role played by information technology in our lives. A degree in computer applications/IT will definitely provide you a promising career. You can become a Software developer, Network administrator, Web developer, Data scientist, Software tester, App developer etc. Even if you don’t pursue B.Tech(CS), you can still have a career in IT. You can pursue Bsc(Computer Science) or BCA, followed by MCA.Career options for PCB students: Botany: With a degree in Botany from a reputed university, you can work as a researcher, teacher/professor, taxonomist, horticulturist, nursery manager or environmental consultant.Zoology: A degree in Zoology from a reputed university will give you the skills required to become a wildlife rehabilitator, animal breeder, wildlife biologist and conservationist. Apart from these, you can also become a teacher/professor.Allied medicine: This is a wide domain that consists of different healthcare careers that are distinct from doctors, yet assist doctors in their work. Trending fields include: Occupational therapist, radio technician, audiologist, clinical researcher, physiotherapist and medical laboratory technologist.Biotechnology: You can go into pharmaceuticals, healthcare, genetics, or clinical research. Many government and private industries in the fields of agriculture, animal husbandry, nutrition, cosmetics, marine biotechnology, environmental conservation and waste management, etc. hire candidates with degrees in biotechnology. You can also work in sales and marketing, quality control, administration, or as a laboratory assistant or a field technician.Genetics: Jobs related to genetics include becoming a geneticist, immunologist, cytogeneticist, forensic DNA analyst, medical technologist, geneticist, pharmacologist, clinical research associate, research scientist, etc. Refer to the link below to know more about career in genetics.Genetics As A Career - Mindler
